paragraph: Ron Miles (born May 9, 1963) is an American jazz trumpeter, cornetist, and composer. He has recorded for the labels Prolific (1986), Capri (1990), and Gramavision.

Miles moved to Denver, Colorado from Indianapolis at the age of 11 and attended Denver East High School. He studied music at the University of Denver (1981â€“1985) and the Manhattan School of Music (1986). He is among Denver's most prominent jazz musicians. He is the co-ordinator of Jazz Studies at Metropolitan State University of Denver.
1999: The Sweetest Punch (Decca, 1999) with Elvis Costello
2012: Floratone II (Savoy Jazz) with FloratoneWith Fred Hess
2002: The Long and Short of It (Tapestry)
1999: Ginger Baker and the DJQ2O, Coward of the County (Atlantic)
2008: Rich Lamb, Music Along the Way (Rich Lamb)
Ron Miles: Singing Through The Horn. NPR March 19, 2009
Cornet Player Ron Miles Embraces His Pop Influences On 'Rainbow Sign'. WYPR November 4, 2020
